summary: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers plans and builds much of the nation's flood risk management infrastructure—including levees, dams, and floodgates—that protect communities from extreme weather events and rising sea levels due to climate change. We identified 14 options the Corps can take to enhance the climate resilience of flood risk management infrastructure. This includes updating planning guidance to require that all projects incorporate how...
title: Climate Change: Options to Enhance the Resilience of Federally Funded Flood Risk Management Infrastructure
